author: Scott Leonard

review: I always liked the idea of something like the Roku box or Apple TV, but I didn't want yet another box sitting under my TV. I didn't quite see the point of the Chromecast, though, until I used it at a friend's house. I put my cellphone on his wifi network and just like that I could go to YouTube or Netflix and broadcast to his TV without any setup on my part. The fact that it works with Netflix, YouTube, HBO Go, and Pandora (and more) is awesome and it's way easier than going through an Xbox or another media box, at least if you don't have a keyboard hooked up to them. I can even broadcast a tab from Google Chrome. I was so impressed I got one for my mom and my brother. Even my technology challenged mom can use it with ease, and she loves it too. The only negative is that you can't use it at hotels that require a web login to their internet. That's a bummer because it's so tiny it would be great to travel with.
author: LadySmarmalade

review: I am a total Google fan-boy so I had to buy this when I first heard about it.  I will say that it still needs a lot of room for improvement.There are not many "apps" for it.  And the few apps that DO work (see full list here: [...] ) are glitchy and will cause issues.  Also, the phone apps are full of problems.  I have a iPhone 5 and my wife has a galaxy S4 (android) and the app will stop responding randomly.  Mine also randomly turns off for no reason.The key feature for this thing is that you can just send any page on chrome to your television in a click.  This is really cool and great for presentations.  But as a media device, this falls short.But that doesn't mean don't buy this!  Google is great about supporting their products and in due time the Chromecast will be a great tool, but for right now, get a Roku player if you want a media machine.
author: Adam A.

review: I love it, especially for the price. No cables, no wires, take with you anywhere. When it is plugged into the HDMI port of your TV, it can turn on the TV and switch the input to itself when used for display from phone or chrome browser. The only reason I gave it a 4 star is because some apps on my phone still dont take advantage of this & sometimes I can't stop the video playing and switch to something else instantaneously.
